thread.title: Anup Shetty triumphs in city's first ever triathlon event
thread.title_full: Anup Shetty triumphs in city's first ever triathlon event - The Times of India

author: Jaideep Shenoy
title: Anup Shetty triumphs in city's first ever triathlon event
text:
MANGALURU: City's first triathlon event organized on Sunday under an initiative of Ground Sport Fitness saw Anup Shetty bag the first place in a time of 86 minutes. Ashwin D'Silva with time of 88 minutes finished second. Ashel D'Silva and Sinchana Gowda took first two places on the distaff side. Triathlon is multiple-stage competition of three continuous/sequential endurance disciplines involving swimming, cycling and running in immediate succession over various distances.
The event started with cycling from Nanthoor to Tannirbavi beach and back, followed by running, and then swimming at Eden Aquatics and Sports Club. The event was divided into two categories - sprint triathlon and amateur triathlon. Sprint triathlon comprised of swimming of 750mts, cycling of 20kms and running of 5kms. Amateur triathlon comprised of swimming of 250mts, cycling of 10kms and running of 2.5kms. There were over 60 participants of varying age groups.
The triathlon was an initiative by Ground Sport Fitness to spread awareness on the benefits of an active lifestlyle, noted Suraj Shetty, head coach, Ground Sport Fitness. "Participants have been training for the Triathlon for the past four weeks to condition their bodies for the event under my supervision," Suraj noted, adding the gym conducts regular sessions on functional training which is balanced, total-body fitness program and encompasses high intensity interval training.
